title: Accessing 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Products with R
text: Now select just "annual forb grass biomass" layers, iterate , plot. symbolizing common range [0,500] pounds per acre color scheme consistent year year. write iteration function called makeplot() use {gifski} render animated GIF file R plot graphics output year total 39 layers. Using {gifski} package save_gif() function can easily create animated graphic RAP predictions:
code: makeplot <- function() {   lapply(grep("annual_forb_and_grass", names(rap)), function(i) {     terra::plot(       rap[[i]],       main = names(rap)[i],       type = "continuous",       range = c(0, 500),       cex.main = TRUE     )     terra::plot(       terra::as.lines(p),       col = "white",       add = TRUE     )   }) } try({    library(gifski)  gifski::save_gif(makeplot(),                   gif_file = "annual_forb_and_grass_biomass.gif",                   delay = 0.5)  }) ## [1] "annual_forb_and_grass_biomass.gif"

what: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: goal {rapr} provide simple R interface ‘Rangeland Analysis Platform’ (RAP) products. See https://rangelands.app/products citation("rapr") information. Two sets RAP products available (see get_rap() source argument). "rap-30m" Landsat-derived approximately 30 meter resolution WGS84 decimal degrees ("EPSG:4326"). data source used ‘rapr’ package since 2022. "rap-10m" Sentinel 2-derived 10 meter resolution local WGS84 UTM zone ("EPSG:326XX", XX two digit UTM zone number). newer (2025) data source.

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: "rap-30m" can query several Landsat derived annual biomass, cover, Net Primary Productivity products 1986 present: product = "vegetation-biomass" returns two layers per year: 2 Bands:"annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass" (lbs / acre) product = "vegetation-cover" returns six layers per year: 6 Bands: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (% cover) product = "vegetation-npp" returns four layers per year: 4 Bands: "annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (NPP; kg*C/m^2) "rap-10m" can query several Sentinel 2 derived cover products 10 meter resolution 2018 present: product = "pft" returns fractional cover estimates plant functional types: 6 Bands: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (% cover) product = "gap" returns canopy gap estimates four canopy gap size classes: 4 Bands: "Gaps 25-50 cm", "Gaps 51-100 cm", "Gaps 100-200 cm", "Gaps >200 cm" (% cover) product = "arte" returns cover estimates Artemisia species, including . arbuscula, . cana, . nova, . tridentata, . tripartita. 1 Band: "Artemisia spp." (% cover) product = "iag" returns fractional cover estimates Bromus tectorum, B. arvensis, B. rubens, B. hordeaceus, Eremopyrum triticeum, Schismus spp., Taeniatherum caput-medusae, Ventenata dubia. 1 Band: "invasive annual grass" (% cover) product = "pj" returns fractional cover estimates Juniperus monosperma, J. occidentalis, J. osteosperma, J. scopulorum, Pinus edulis, P. monophylla. 1 Band: "pinyon-juniper" (% cover)

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: Large requests may generate intermediate objects stored temporary files. See terra::tmpFiles() view file paths. files removed R session ends.

what: Alternate Specification of Area of Interest
title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: lieu spatial object {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} packages may specify bounding box using numeric vector containing top-left bottom-right coordinates (xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin) WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees. corresponds conventional order used gdal_translate -projwin option. e.g. get_rap(x = c(-120, 37, -119.99, 36.99), ...).

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: Native cell resolution "rap-30m" approximately 30m x 30m WGS84 geographic coordinate system (longitude, latitude). Native cell resolution "rap-10m" 10m x 10m local (projected) WGS84 Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) system. "rap-10m" requests spanning multiple UTM zones, either pass SpatRaster object x specify template argument. lieu user-specified grid system multi-zone requests, default CONUS Albers Equal Area projection ("EPSG:5070") 10 m resolution used. See [rap_projection()] options details.

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: can install {rapr} CRAN: can install development version {rapr} GitHub :

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products
text: example shows use {terra} SpatVector containing rectangular polygon rapr::get_rap() obtain RAP grids corresponding extent. {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} objects supported input types. spatial object used Coordinate Reference System defined, input coordinates projected source data grid system.  lieu spatial object {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} packages may specify bounding box using numeric vector containing xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees (corresponding order used gdal_translate -projwin option). e.g. get_rap(x = c(-120, 37, -119.99, 36.99), ...).
code: library(terra) #> terra 1.8.42 library(rapr)  res <- get_rap(   vect("POLYGON ((-120 36.99,-119.99 37,-120 37,-120 36.99))",        crs = "EPSG:4326"),    version = "v3",   product = "vegetation-cover",   years = c(1986, 1996, 2006, 2016),   verbose = TRUE ) #> Processing: http://rangeland.ntsg.umt.edu/data/rap/rap-vegetation-cover/v3/vegetation-cover-v3-1986.tif #> Processing: http://rangeland.ntsg.umt.edu/data/rap/rap-vegetation-cover/v3/vegetation-cover-v3-1996.tif #> Processing: http://rangeland.ntsg.umt.edu/data/rap/rap-vegetation-cover/v3/vegetation-cover-v3-2006.tif #> Processing: http://rangeland.ntsg.umt.edu/data/rap/rap-vegetation-cover/v3/vegetation-cover-v3-2016.tif #> Cropping and writing result to memory or temporary file  res #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 37, 37, 24  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.0002694946, 0.0002694946  (x, y) #> extent      : -120, -119.99, 36.99002, 36.99999  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> source(s)   : memory #> names       : veget~grass, veget~round, veget~itter, veget~grass, veget~shrub, veget~_tree, ...  #> min values  :           0,           0,           0,           0,           0,           0, ...  #> max values  :          80,          26,          33,          74,          13,           9, ...  #> unit        :     % cover,     % cover,     % cover,     % cover,     % cover,     % cover, ...  #> time (years): 1986 to 2016 (2 steps)  plot(res) (1: xmin, 2: ymax)--------------------------|         |                                   |         |         TARGET EXTENT             |         |  x = c(xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin)    |         |                                   |         |---------------------------(3: xmax, 4: ymin)

title: Interface to Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Products

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: Two sets 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) products available (see source argument). "rap-30m" Landsat-derived approximately 30 meter resolution WGS84 decimal degrees ("EPSG:4326"). data source used 'rapr' package since 2022. newer source (2025), "rap-10m", Sentinel 2-derived 10 meter resolution local WGS84 UTM zone ("EPSG:326XX", XX two digit UTM zone number). See Details products bands available different resolutions sources.

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
code: get_rap(   x,   years,   product,   filename = NULL,   ...,   source = "rap-30m",   version = "v3",   vrt = FALSE,   sds = FALSE,   legacy = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: x Target extent. Derived sf, terra, raster sp object numeric vector containing xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin WGS84 decimal degrees (longitude/latitude, "EPSG:4326"). years integer. Year(s) query. Products available 1986 (source="rap-30m") 2018 (source="rap-10m") year prior current year, based availability Landsat Sentinel 2 source data. product Target data: "vegetation-biomass", "vegetation-cover", /"vegetation-npp" source="rap-30m"; "pft" (plant functional type cover), "gap" (canopy gap), "arte" (Artemisia spp. cover), "iag" (invasive annual grass cover), "pj" (pinyon juniper cover) source="rap-10m". filename Output filename (optional; default stores temporary file memory, see terra::tmpFiles()) ... Additional arguments passed internal query function terra::writeRaster() (terra::vrt() vrt=TRUE) source Grid sources. Options include "rap-30m" (default; Landsat) "rap-10m" (Sentinel 2). version Target version: "v3" /"v2" ("rap-30m"). Currently ignored source="rap-10m". vrt logical. Short circuit return Virtual Raster Dataset (VRT) selected grids via terra::vrt(). Default: FALSE. Note: gdalbuildvrt support heterogeneous projection systems, option compatible source="rap-10m" multiple UTM zone areas interest. sds logical. Return data SpatRasterDataset? Helpful results containing multiple years products. Default FALSE returns SpatRaster object. legacy logical. Use legacy (gdal_translate) method? Default: TRUE (applies source="rap-30m"). verbose logical. Print messages indicating progress? Default: TRUE. legacy=TRUE progress shown using utils::txtProgressBar().

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: SpatRaster containing requested product layers year. sds=TRUE SpatRasterDataset SpatRaster contains one product (possibly multiple years)

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: "rap-30m" can query several Landsat derived annual biomass, cover, Net Primary Productivity products 1986 present: product = "vegetation-biomass" returns two layers per year: 2 Bands:"annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass" (lbs / acre) product = "vegetation-cover" returns six layers per year: 6 Bands: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (% cover) product = "vegetation-npp" returns four layers per year: 4 Bands: "annual forb grass", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree" (NPP; kg*C/m^2) "rap-10m" can query several Sentinel 2 derived cover products 10 meter resolution 2018 present: product = "pft" returns fractional cover estimates plant functional types: 6 Bands: "annual forb grass", "bare ground", "litter", "perennial forb grass", "shrub", "tree"  (% cover) product = "gap" returns canopy gap estimates four canopy gap size classes: 4 Bands: "Gaps 25-50 cm", "Gaps 51-100 cm", "Gaps 100-200 cm", "Gaps >200 cm"  (% cover) product = "arte" returns cover estimates Artemisia species, including . arbuscula, . cana, . nova, . tridentata, . tripartita. 1 Band: "Artemisia spp." (% cover) product = "iag" returns fractional cover estimates Bromus tectorum, B. arvensis, B. rubens, B. hordeaceus, Eremopyrum triticeum, Schismus spp., Taeniatherum caput-medusae, Ventenata dubia. 1 Band: "invasive annual grass" (% cover) product = "pj" returns fractional cover estimates Juniperus monosperma, J. occidentalis, J. osteosperma, J. scopulorum, Pinus edulis, P. monophylla. 1 Band: "pinyon-juniper" (% cover)

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: Large requests may generate intermediate objects stored temporary files. See terra::tmpFiles() view file paths. files removed R session ends.

what: Alternate Specification of Area of Interest
title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: lieu spatial object {terra}, {raster}, {sf} {sp} packages may specify bounding box using numeric vector containing top-left bottom-right coordinates (xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin) WGS84 longitude/latitude decimal degrees. corresponds conventional order used gdal_translate -projwin option. e.g. get_rap(x = c(-120, 37, -119.99, 36.99), ...).

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: Native cell resolution "rap-30m" approximately 30m x 30m WGS84 geographic coordinate system (longitude, latitude). Native cell resolution "rap-10m" 10m x 10m local (projected) WGS84 Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) system. "rap-10m" requests spanning multiple UTM zones, either pass SpatRaster object x specify template argument. lieu user-specified grid system multi-zone requests, default CONUS Albers Equal Area projection ("EPSG:5070") 10 m resolution used. See rap_projection() options details.

title: Get 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Grids — get_rap
text: See citation("rapr") references related Rangeland Analysis Platform products.

what: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
text: function provides several "standard" projected Coordinate Reference Systems suitable representing Rangeland Analysis Platform products across contiguous (lower 487) United States specified resolution (meters).

title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
text: x character. One "CONUS_AEA", "CONUS_EQUI7", "CONUS_IGH" res integer. Resolution meters.

title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
text: SpatRaster object using standard extent (xmin,ymax,xmax,ymin), resolution projected Coordinate Reference System.

title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
text: Currently three pre-calculated grid systems extent designed align 1, 5, 10, 30, 100, 300 meter resolutions. "CONUS_AEA" default template used get_rap(source="rap-10m") data spanning multiple UTM zones requested, unless user specifies template via SpatRaster object x template argument.

title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
text: "CONUS_AEA": Albers Equal Area Conic projection CONUS extent. xmin = -2356300 ymax = 3172500 xmax = 2264000 ymin = 270000 crs = "EPSG:5070" "CONUS_EQUI7: Equi7Grid projection CONUS + Hawaii extent. xmin = 599500 ymax = 4967500 xmax = 10737100 ymin = 1913500 crs = "EPSG:27705" "CONUS_IGH": Interrupted Goode Homolosine projection CONUS extent. xmin = -13390500 ymax = 5836700 xmax = -8268600 ymin = 2480600 crs = "+proj=igh"

title: Select Projection System for RAP Extent — rap_projection
code: rap_projection("CONUS_AEA", 10) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 290250, 462030, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 10, 10  (x, y) #> extent      : -2356300, 2264000, 270000, 3172500  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : NAD83 / Conus Albers (EPSG:5070)   rap_projection("CONUS_IGH", 100) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 33561, 51219, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 100, 100  (x, y) #> extent      : -13390500, -8268600, 2480600, 5836700  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : +proj=igh +lon_0=0 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs

what: rapr: Interface to 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Products — rapr-package
title: rapr: Interface to 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Products — rapr-package
text: Provides access 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) products https://rangelands.app/products arbitrary extents via 'GDAL' virtual file system.

title: rapr: Interface to 'Rangeland Analysis Platform' (RAP) Products — rapr-package
text: Maintainer: Andrew Brown andrew.g.brown@usda.gov (ORCID) contributors: Georgia Harrison (ORCID) [contributor]

title: rapr 1.0.0 (development)
text: details new RAP 10m products see: http://rangeland.ntsg.umt.edu/data/rangeland-s2/README citation("rapr") Default behavior (template=NULL) return SpatRaster native grid system requested RAP source. large area interest (spans multiple UTM zones source="rap-10m") standard “EPSG:5070” grid system used template set user Added vrt argument. vrt=TRUE merging/resampling process bypassed GDAL VRT file generated reference source directly. Added legacy argument. Default (legacy=FALSE) behavior use GDAL via terra raster vector data processing. Set legacy=TRUE use sf gdal_translate implementation rapr 0.1.x.

title: rapr 1.0.0 (development)
text: Default behavior use GDAL via terra raster data processing. Set legacy=TRUE use sf gdal_translate implementation rapr 0.1.x. SpatRaster objects passed x now used template output conforms input grid system. avoid behavior either specify template desired grid template, convert SpatRaster polygon extent terra::.polygons(ext=TRUE) (similar) progress argument replaced verbose; legacy=TRUE

title: rapr 1.0.0 (development)
text: Simplified vignette: replaced knitr rmarkdown litedown Simplified unit testing suite: replaced testthat tinytest

title: rapr 0.1.2 (2024-10-24)
text: First tagged GitHub release Check output directory exists writing output path specified filename (#3)

title: rapr 0.1.1 (2022-03-21)
text: Updated default arguments (years, product) get_rap() Added new vignette titled “Accessing Rangeland Analysis Platform (RAP) Data R” Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
